description: From Ancient Greek ἐπικεραστικός (epikerastikós), from ἐπικεραννύναι (epikerannúnai, “to temper”).

adjectives.description: epicerastic (comparative more epicerastic, superlative most epicerastic)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, rare) Relieving the harshness or bitterness of certain bodily humours; (loosely), soothing, emollient.
examples: Epicerastic medicines obtund the acrimony of the humours, and mitigate the uneasy sensation thence arising.

entries.meaning: (rare, obsolete) A medicine or herb having such an effect.
examples: Epicerastick […] is a Medicine that assuages and corrects sharp Humours.
